qas.question: Where is the Royal Institute Library's Reading Room located?
Where are RIBA's Study Rooms located?

answers.text: the Henry Cole Wing of the V&A

qas.question: What art style was used inthe design of the Reading Room?
In what year did the Royal Institute's Reading Rooms open?
Who is meant to benefit from teaching provided by the RIBA library?
Where is the Royal Institute Library's Reading Room formerly located?

plausible_answers.text: the Henry Cole Wing of the V&A

qas.question: Where are RIBA's Study Rooms not located?
What art style was not used in the design of the Reading Room?
What year did the Royal Institute's Reading Rooms close?
Who is not meant to benefit from the teaching provided by the RIBA library?

context: The library is based at two public sites: the Reading Room at the RIBA's headquarters, <a0_0><b5_0>66 Portland Place<a0_0/>, London<b5_0/>; and the RIBA Architecture Study Rooms in <a1_0><b6_0>the Henry Cole Wing of the V&A<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The Reading Room, designed by the building's architect George Grey Wornum and his wife Miriam, retains its original 1934 <a2_0><b7_0>Art Deco<b7_0/><a2_0/> interior with open bookshelves, original furniture and double-height central space. The study rooms, opened in <a3_0><b8_0>2004<b8_0/><a3_0/>, were designed by Wright & Wright. The library is funded entirely by the RIBA but it is open to the public without charge. It operates a free education programme aimed at <a4_0><b9_0>students, education groups and families<b9_0/><a4_0/>, and an information service for RIBA members and the public through the RIBA Information Centre.
